subject: Re: Problems running JUnit
msgSnippet: Hello again, I not sure if you meen my classpath or path, both in the enviromantal variables. My path looks like this: C: Programfiler Java jdk1.5.0_03
messageBody:
Hello again,
I not sure if you meen my classpath or path, both in the enviromantal
variables. My path looks like this:

C:\Programfiler\Java\jdk1.5.0_03
\bin;c:\Perl\bin;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32
\Wbem;c:\xalan\xalan-j_2_7_0\xml-apis.jar;c:\xalan\xalan-j_2_7_0
\xercesImpl.jar.;C:\Programfiler\IDM Computer Solutions\UltraEdit-
32;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32
\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\DPDrv;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\Syste
m32\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\DPDrv;C:\junit4.1\junit-4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;

and my classpath looks like this:

C:\Ifi\Java\easyIO.jar;C:\junit4.1\junit-
4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;C:\Ifi\Java;;.



I can run javac with these settings, but not junit.


still problems and the same error:

NoClassDefFoundError: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore


BR
Magnus


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jochen Hiller" <jo.hiller@...> wrote:
>
> Check your classpath: you have to add junit-4.1.jar too your
classpath
> (assuming you use JUnit 4.1). The message indicates, that
> org.junit.runner.JUnitCore has not been found.
>
> And make sure, that your classes (TestX) are also available at
classpath.
>
> HTH, Jochen
>
> -----Urspr√ºngliche Nachricht-----
> Von: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]Im
Auftrag von
> t703093
> Gesendet: Freitag, 20. Oktober 2006 14:13
> An: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Betreff: [junit] Problems running JUnit
>
>
> Hello,
> I have two simple classes:
>
> /////////////////class1
>
> public class X {
> public int met (int number) {
> int num = number;
> if (num > 1)
> return num*2;
> else{
> return 666;
> }
> }
> }
>
> /////////////////class2 (the test class JUnit-class)
>
> public class TestX {
> public static void main (String args[]){
> X y = new X();
> System.out.println(y.met(1));
> }
> }
>
> and I want to use JUnit to test them, maybe like this:
>
> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore TestX
>
> But I get this:
> NoClassDefFoundError: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
>
> I guess the problem is that JUnit do not find
> org.junit.runner.JUnitCore TestX
> ?
>
> Anybody have some tips?
>
> BR
>
> Magnus
>
>
>
>
>
